text.__SUMMARY__: Gymnopilus subtropicus is a species of mushroom in the Cortinariaceae family.
text.Description: The cap is 1 to 4.5 centimetres (0.4 to 1.8 in) in diameter.
text.Habitat and distribution: Gymnopilus subtropicus grows on oak and palm logs. It has been found in Florida, Mississippi, Louisiana, Hawaii, during March and from June to August.
